Desc.entry: A specialist agency working with under-supported people, many of whom have been involved in the criminal justice system, are in or leaving care, homeless, may be parents or are facing deficits in their education affecting their employment prospects. Offers the following services: Basic skills programmes - offering accredited literacy and numeracy learning with City & Guilds; Preparation 4 Work - for clients who are job-ready or wish to enter mainstream education - areas covered include CV preparation, interview skills, disclosure advice, job search and work preparation; IAG - Information, Advice and Guidance on learning and work opportunities; Employer Engagement Programme - supporting and working with employers promoting the "business case" of employing and offering work placements to offenders and ex-offenders; Learning Support Programme - dedicated workers to assist, motivate, guide and support offenders into education and skills development programmes, throughout the Sheffield area; "Steps To Success" Short Vocational Courses - a programme of activities specifically focused at training which will increase the job opportunities for offenders and ex-offenders including health and safety, first aid, fork lift driving and the CSCS card; recruitment and training of volunteers to provide mentoring and administration duties; an allotment where staff, service users and volunteers work to grow vegetables and fruit which is given to the service users. Catch22 is a registered charity.
